captions.text:
Hey Vsauce, I'm Jake and potato chips or crisps
were invented 160 years ago in Saratoga Springs,

NY by a chef named George Crum. You can use
the Food Timeline to uncover the origins of

pretty much every food like nachos, gingerbread
or the old classic, cock-a-leekie. If you

want something meatier, you just need to find
the invisible cow .com But let's use the Minecraft

logo generator and check out some more DONGS...things
you can do online now guys.

Sid is a robot you control in real time, using
your computer. You queue up and once it's

your turn, use Sid to grab a ball and drop
it into one of the surrounding holes. You

are only in control for 45 seconds and the
holes that get you more points are further

away so you have to strategize your moves
if you want a top score.

If all you really want though is to wait in
line, then try Waiting in Line...3D. Where

you wait in line...and punch yourself in the
face. Wow. Such real. Much fist. Many Lines.

A fun drawing tool that has you directing
patterns of lines using your cursor. You can

give them color, reduce their number and can
make them fade away. Once you finish your

masterpiece compare it using Toddler or Modern
Art.

A surprisingly difficult quiz where you decide
if the artwork was created by an adult artist
or an infant.

For more art there is Street Photography from
GTA5. Photography student Fernando Gomes goes

around Los Santos snapping photos with the
cell phone cameras getting some pretty cool
shots.

After exploring the streets of Los Santos,
explore Middle Earth. THis Hobbit chrome experiment

has you outrunning and dodging Trolls in Trollshaw,
spending some time in Rivendell, or escaping
evil in Dol Guldur.

Then wander off into this Corn Maze you go
through using Google street view. If you get
lost, use your emergency yodel button.

Or drive out of there with Hotline Trail.
Try and control your vehicle on a road that

continuously grows in random directions and
blurs. Before getting behind the wheel though

use what side of the road to find out which
countries drive on what side of the street.

Once you figure it out, hit the Accelerator,
a fast paced game where your speed increases

the more obstacles you dodge, and the more
obstacles you dodge the faster and more frequent
they become.

For something a little slower paced, be a
leaf on the wind. A fun little game that has

you gliding across the screen collecting green
orbs, avoiding red ones and obtaining power
ups.

While you're floating around, check how much
your Steam library is worth with Steam Gauge.

Then compare that number to how much the top
technology companies make every second and

imagine how all the Scrooge McDuck gold coin
pools it could fill.

If all those numbers become intimidating use
Mathigon. Mathigon's World of Mathematics

is an incredibly cool interactive eBook that
presents some of the most interesting mathematical

ideas in a really engaging way. You can learn
about fractals, graph theory, probability
and more.

But the most important math to know is obviously
Pizzarithmetic which tells you how many pizzas

to order depending on the number of people
who will be feasting on said circular disc
of doughliciousness.

If you need more people for your pizza party
use some of these dictionary definition pick

up lines, for example... Girl, you must be
a Darwinism because you are a theory of biological

evolution developed by Charles Darwin and
others, stating that all species of organisms

arise and develop through the natural selection
of small, inherited variations that increase

the individual's ability to compete, survive
and reproduce.

Once you've got all your friends together
have a GIF Dance Party. Add a myriad of different

dancing gifs, change the background, the song
and share your dance party's URL to invite
more friends.

Leave the party and find your Pokemon. Hmm,
not sure how I feel about that choice so instead

I'm going to guess your number. The number
I'm thinking of is 10 and wouldn't ya know

it, it guessed 10. Combine the different numbers
or subtract them to get the total to hit 10.

It starts to get pretty complicated as the
game progresses because if you do your addition
out of order, you might be out of luck.

So lets keep using our brains with RobinWords.
Cange one letter in the four letter word to

create a new one, then the computer does the
same and you continue on until all possible
words have been used.

While battling the computer, use Noisli to
create some peaceful background noises like
a distant thunderstorm or the woods.

If you want more noise, I made another JAM,
a Just Awesome Music leanback for you over

on WEsauce, so listen to that while you check
out these DONGs, and as always, thanks for
watching.

title: Control This Robot RIGHT NOW! -- DONG
